titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäṣḥafä gәbrä ḥǝmamat “Book of the Rite of the Holy Week” (fols. 1ra- 174rb) I-1) Introduction (fols. 1ra-3ra) I-2) Eve of Palm Sunday (fols. 3ra-5rb) I-3) Palm Sunday (fols. 5rb-10vc) I-4) Monday (fols. 10vc-25va) - Night hours (fols. 10vc-13ra) - Day hours (fols. 13ra-25va), including: Homily by John Chrysostom for Monday morning (fols. 16va-17rc); Homily by John Chrysostom on the fig tree (fols. 17rc-20rb) I-5) Tuesday (fols. 25va-39va) - Night hours (fols. 25va-27vb) - Day hours (fols. 27vb-39va) I-6) Wednesday (fols. 39va-53rc) - Night hours (fols. 39va-44ra), including: Homily by John Chrysostom on the Ten Virgins (fols. 40vb-43va) - Day hours (fols. 44rb-53rc) I-7) Thursday (fols. 53rc-69rb) - Night hours (fols. 53rc-55vc) - Day hours (fols. 55vc-69rb) I-8) Friday (fols. 69rc-138rb) - Night hours (fols. 74vb-99vb), including: Mäṣḥafä dorho “Book of the Cock” (fols. 69rc-73rb); Homily by Ephrem on the Passion of Our Lord and on the thief on the right hand (fols. 78rc-80ra); Homily by Jaqob of Serug on the angel and the thief (fols. 80ra-84rb); Homily by Dionysius the Aeropagite on the crucifixion (fols. 84rb-84vc); Homily by John [Chrysostom] on Christ when He says “If it be possible, let this chalice pass” (fols. 89rb-92rb) - Day hours (fols. 99vb-137rb), including: Homily by Jaqob of Serug on Abraham (fols. 109rc-114vb); Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 135va-137vb) I-9) Saturday (fols. 138rb-163rc) - Night hours (fols. 138rb-163rc), including: Raʾǝyä Yoḥannǝs “Revelation of John” (fols. 141vc-153rb); Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat “Teaching of Mysteries” (fols. 159vc-161rb) I-10) Homily of Cyriacus of Behnesa [Laḥa Maryam “Lamentation of Mary”] (fols. 164ra-174rb)
Additio 1.

copyists.copyist: Gäbrä Ḥǝywät is mentioned as the scribe in the subscription on fol. 163rb.

donors.donor: Kidanä Maryam, baptismal name of Ras Sǝbḥat (Arägawi? b. ca. 1844, d. 1914), is mentioned as the donor in Additio 1 and in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. Other members of his family are mentioned in the colophon.

dcomments.dcomment: King Mәnilәk II (r. 1889-1913) is mentioned in the supplication formula in fol. 65rc.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather (two separate pieces sewn together along the middle of the spine); textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover and turn-ins (at least 5 tools are used: triple line fillet, double circle, cross hatching, x-form, criss-cross).

bnothers.bnother: One pairs of chains of endband stitches through the spine cover (headband).

squires.squire: ፩I፩(8/fols. 1r-8v) – II፪(8/fols. 9r-16v) – III፫(8/fols. 17r-24v) – IV፬(9/fols. 25r-32v) – V፭(8/fols. 33r-40v) – VI፮(8/fols. 41r-48v) – VII፯(8/fols. 49r-56v) – VIII(8/fols. 57r-64v) – IX(8/fols. 65r-72v) – X(8/fols. 73r-80v) – XI(4/fols. 81r-84v) – XII(8/fols. 85r-92v) – XIII(7; s.l.: 5, stub after 2/fols. 93r-99v) – XIV፫(8/fols. 100r-107v) – XV(8/fols. 108r-115v) – XVI፭(8/fols. 116r-123v) – XVII፮(8/fols. 124r-131v) – XVIII፯(8/fols. 132r-139v) – XIX፰(8/fols. 140r-147v) – XX፱(8/fols. 148r-155v) – XXI(8/fols. 156r-163v) – XXII(8/fols. 164r-171v) – XXIII(5; s.l.: 5, stub before 1/fols. 172r-175v) – B1(2/fols. 177r-178v) – B2(2/fols. 179r-180v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are not visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the donor; name of the scribe (fol. 163rb); name of the ruling king (fol. 65rc); names of the donor´s relatives in the colophon; headings and incipits of the texts, their sections and subsections; a few lines are rubricated alternating with black lines e.g., fols. 1r, 5rb, 13ra, 20rb, 25va, 39va, 55rc, 68vb, 85r, 103vb, 114vb, 164r; excerpts of hymns for the Good Friday (fols. 101v, 102r, 102v, 107v, 108r, 108v, 120v, 121r, 121v, 127v); titles of the Biblical books and other works; directives for the ministers or their abbreviations; elements of quire mark (fol. 1r); names of Hebrew letters in fols. 130rc-130vc (Lam. 3); the words, yǝbe, yǝbǝl, yǝtärägwǝm, mätärgwǝm, nastäbäqqwǝʿ ḫabekä (fols. 65ra-65rc), zä-ʾǝmṗäraqliṭos (fols. 84vc-87ra), dorho (in Mäṣḥafä dorho, Text 1-8), täzäkärännä, yǝtäqǝnäyu, yaṭǝfʿu (fols. 122ra-122va), ṣälläyu (fol. 139r); ʾǝgziʾo täśähalännä (fols. 161va-168vb ); the letters sǝ (fols. 133va-133vc), ʾo (fols. 138vb-138vc); initial words in “Tǝmḫǝrtä ḫǝbuʾat” (Text 1-9); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይሕ፡ for ይብል፡ ሕዝብ፡ ይካ፡ for ይብል፡ ካህን፡ ይዲ፡ for ይብል፡ ዲያቆን፡ ሰ፡ for ስቡኒ፡ ውእቱ፡ ወልዑልኒ፡ (fols. 133va-133vc) ኦ፡ for ኦእግዚእነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ (fols. 138vb-138vc)

additional.cont: Fol. 163va: Donation note extended by the list of the donor´s children and deceased relatives.
additional.tran: Fol.163va: This is the book of ras Səbḥat which he donated to (the church of) St. Michael Nəhəb, and his baptismal name is Kidanä Maryam and the names of his children (are) Wäldä Gäbrəˀel, ˀArˀaya Śəllase, Wäldä ˀArägäwi, Zä-Mänfäs Qəddus, Śəmrätä ˀAb, Säbänä Maryam...
additional.det: A list of the donor´s relatives is given. The note is written in the same hand as that of the main text.

extras.extra: - Excerpts from hymns for the Good Friday (?) added in the upper margin: fols. 101v, 102r, 102v, 107v, 108r, 108v, 120v, 121r, 121v, 127v. - Corrections written with blue pen: fol. 51r. - Stamp with the name of the donor (ras Sǝbḥat): fols. 1r, 55r, 95r, 142r, 164r, 174r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire mark is written in the upper margins of fol. 1r. - Undecorated quire marks are written in the bottom margin of the last fol. of some quires, fols. 8v, 16v, 24v, 32v, 40v, 48v, 56v, 107v, 123v, 131v, 139v, 147v, 155v. From fol. 107v the numeration is not regular.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - The time and respective readings are written, within a decorative frame, in the upper margin: bä-räbuʾ dǝrsan zä-dänagǝl: fol. 40v mäṣḥafä dorho bä-ʿarb: fol. 69r dǝrsanä fäyatawi zä-yǝtnäbbäb bä-6 säʿat: fol. 78r bä-ʾǝntä mälʾak wäfäyatawi bä-ʾarb; zä-yǝtnäbbäb bä-7 säʾat zä-ʾarb: fol. 80r ʾAbuqälämsis; zä-yǝtnäbbäb bä-6 säʿat: fols. 141v-142r laḥa Maryam dǝngǝl; mǝnbab bä-lelitä tǝnśaʾe: fol. 164r

drawing.info: Fol. 1r (bottom): three Stars of David, in black and red ink.
Fol. 84v (bottom): Star of David, in black and red ink.
